    Class DialogViewModel

    Implementation of IDialogViewModel. This abstract class implements the dialog data handling logic and is therefore preferred over a custom implementation of IDialogViewModel.

    Inheritance

    Namespace: BionicCode.Utilities.Net.Wpf.Dialog
    Assembly: BionicCode.Utilities.Net.Wpf.dll
    Syntax
    public abstract class DialogViewModel : ViewModel, IDialogViewModel, IViewModel, IProgressReporter, IViewModelCommon, INotifyDataErrorInfo, IProgressReporterCommon, INotifyPropertyChanged
    Remarks

    It is recommended to use the Dialog attached behavior as it handles the view logic. Just bind DialogDataContextProperty to an instance of DialogViewModel (or IDialogViewModel) and define a DataTemplate for each implementation of DialogViewModel.

    | Improve this Doc View Source

    OnInteractionCompleted()

    Event invocator of the InteractionCompleted event. Raising this event will request the dialog to be closed.

    Declaration
    protected virtual void OnInteractionCompleted()
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    OnInteractionCompleting(CancelEventArgs)

    Event invocator of the InteractionCompleting event. Raised before InteractionCompleted event. When overriding the member, setting the property System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel of the cancelEventArgs parameter to true will cancel the dialog close process.

    Declaration
    protected virtual void OnInteractionCompleting(CancelEventArgs cancelEventArgs)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs cancelEventArgs

    When setting the property System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel of the event's System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs to true will cancel the dialog close process.
    Remarks

    When the dialog close process was cancelled e.g., by overriding the OnInteractionCompleting(CancelEventArgs) method and by setting the cancelEventArgs to true, a new close process can be triggered either by invoking the OnInteractionCompleted() method or by invoking the SendResponseAsyncCommand.
